awd_abstract_narration: This is a two-year program to serve 90 middle school                            mathematics teachers in the Baton Rouge area.  In a six week                    summer session, participants will each take three courses:                      number sense, probability and quantitative literacy, and                        methods of teaching mathematics. The methods course will be                     structured around the NCTM Standards. Sixty teachers will                       participate in year one, and thirty will participate in year                    two. Academic year followup will include visits by project                      staff to individual classrooms and 8 full-day workshops for                     participants. Workshops for principals are included. School                     districts will provide released time for teachers.                                                                                                              Cost sharing is provided at 35% of the NSF award.
org_div_long_name: Division of Research on Learning in Formal and Informal Settings (DRL)
